ThingDef.label: M1 Garand
ThingDef.description: USA. A semi-automatic rifle designed to replace the Springfield 1903. In service since 1936, it was however not produced in sufficient numbers to equip every soldier at the outbreak of the war, especially in The USMC.

ThingDef.label: Springfield 1903
ThingDef.description: USA. The service rifle of the US during WWI abd still was widely spread in the unit escially in the USMC at the outbreak of the Seconde World War.

ThingDef.label: M14
ThingDef.description: USA. The battle rifle which the US came with in Vietnam, not really suited for jungle combat and weather, it was replaced by the M16.

ThingDef.label: M16
ThingDef.description: USA. The M16 is a general-purpose gas-operated assault rifle for field or urban combat. It has good range, decent power, and good accuracy. Designed to replace teh M14.

ThingDef.label: Springfield 1903 scoped
ThingDef.description: USA. The scoped version of the service rifle of the US during WWI and still was widely spread in the unit escially in the USMC at the outbreak of the Seconde World War.

ThingDef.label: M40
ThingDef.description: USA. An extremely precise rifle used by the best American snipers of the Vietnam War.

ThingDef.label: M1897 Trench Gun
ThingDef.description: USA. A late 19th century design uptdated for trench warfare during WWI. Still in use during WWII, it can be "slam fired", increasing it's rate of fire.

ThingDef.label: Double-barrel Shotgun
ThingDef.description: Everywhere. Double barrel Shotgun. Two shot in the barel and and a short range but deadly.

ThingDef.label: US M1
ThingDef.description: USA. A light carbine originaly designed for rear echelon troops, it was well appreciated gun by COs and NCOs, paratroopers and assault troops.

ThingDef.label: US M2
ThingDef.description: USA. A light carbine originaly designed for rear echelon troops, it was well appreciated gun by COs and NCOs, paratroopers and assault troops. The US M2 is a upgraded version with a bayonet lug and a full-auto capability, a 30 rounds magazin was develloped to come with it.

ThingDef.label: XM177
ThingDef.description: USA. The XM177 is a carbine version of the M16 designed for the special forces. Mre Light and compact, its shorter barrel make it less accurate at long distance.

ThingDef.label: M1919A6
ThingDef.description: USA. The M1919A6 is a variant of the famous .30 cal MG. It was an attempt to make it a LMG. It was notably heavier but gota buttstock an got rid of the tripod.

ThingDef.label: BAR M1918
ThingDef.description: USA. The BAR or Browning Automatic Rifle was developed during WWI to give to a squad more firepower.

ThingDef.label: BAR M1918A2
ThingDef.description: USA. The BAR or Browning Automatic Rifle was developed during WWI to give to a squad more firepower.

ThingDef.label: M60
ThingDef.description: USA. The M60 was nicknamed "the pig" by US soldiers due to its wheight. It was however liked for its reliability.

ThingDef.label: Thompson M1928A1
ThingDef.description: USA. The Thompson M1928 is the classic 30s gangster-style SMG, well build and reliable but heavy and really expensive to make.

ThingDef.label: Thompson M1A1
ThingDef.description: USA. The simplified version of the iconic SMG.

ThingDef.label: M3 "Grease Gun"
ThingDef.description: USA. The M3 was designed to replace the way to expensive Thompson. It's way cheaper and have a slower rate of fire.

ThingDef.label: M3 A1 "Grease Gun"
ThingDef.description: USA. The M3 was designed to replace the way to expensive Thompson. It's way cheaper and have a slower rate of fire. The M3A1 variants is an improvement with less fragile parts.

ThingDef.label: SW76
ThingDef.description: USA. A foreign design copied by the US and mostly issued to the special forces.

ThingDef.label: Colt 1911
ThingDef.description: USA. Semi-automatic pistol with a great stopping power, It was the main handgun of the US armed forces during the 20th century.

ThingDef.label: Grenade MkII
ThingDef.description: USA. A frag grenade, nothing special to it.

ThingDef.label: M79
ThingDef.description: USA. Basically a hunting shotgun that shoot 40mm grenades.

ThingDef.label: M9A1 "Bazooka"
ThingDef.description: USA. The M9A1 "Bazooka" is basically a simple tube that allow to fire a Rocket-propelled anti-tank grenade, however it's also useful againt infantry and their cover.

ThingDef.label: M72 LAW
ThingDef.description: USA. The M72 LAW is a simple tube that allow to fire a Rocket-propelled anti-tank grenade, however it's also useful againt infantry and their cover. It's single use but really light and cheap to make.
